name: St. Josemaría Escrivá
summary: Josemaría Escrivá was a Spanish Catholic priest who founded Opus Dei, an organization of laypeople and priests dedicated to the teaching that everyone is called to holiness and that ordinary life is a path to sanctity. He was canonized in 2002 by Pope John Paul II. Opus Dei has grown to include tens of thousands of members worldwide.
keyQuotes: Do everything for Love. Thus there will be no little things: everything will be big. Perseverance in little things for Love is heroism.
The ordinary, unspectacular flow of everyday life should be the setting for our sanctification.
